gurmukhi: XoN suin kY bqIXw iqh kI hir kop khXo hm ju`D krYNgy ] bwn kmwn gdw gih kY doaU BRwq sBY Ar sYn hrYNgy ]
transliteration: Yon Soun(i) Kai Bateeyaa Tih Kihar(i) Kop Kahyo Ham Juddh Darainge|| Baan Kamaan Gadaa Gadh Kai Dooo Bhraat Sabhai Ar Sain Haringe||
translation: Hearing these words, Krishna in great ire, challenged them for war and said, “We, both brothers, taking up our bows and arrows, shall destroy all your army;

gurmukhi: sUr iSvwidk qy n BjY hin hY qum kau nih jUJ prYNgy ] myru hlY suk hY iniD bwr qaU rn kI iCq qy n trYNgy ]1187]
transliteration: Soor Shivaadik Te Na Bhajai Han(i) Hai Toum Kau Nah(i) Toum Kau Nah(i) Joojh Darainge|| Mer(u) Halai Souk Hai Nidh(i) Baar Taoo Ran Kichhit Te Na Darainge||1187||
translation: “We have not been frightened even by Surya and Shive, therefore, we shall kill all of you and sacrifice ourselves; even if the Sumeru mountain is moved and the water of the ocean is dried up, we shall not leave the battlefield.”1187.

gurmukhi: XO kih kY bqIXw iqn so ks bwn ArIn kI Er clwXo ] lwg gXo Ajbys ky b`C su lwgq hI kCu Kyd n pwXo ]
transliteration: Yau Kah(i) Bateeyaa Tin So Kas Baandareen Kior Chalaayo|| Laag Gado Ajbes Ke Bachchh Su Laagad Hikachhu Khed Na Paayo||
translation: Saying thus, he discharged one arrow towards the enemies with full strength, which hit the waist of Ajaib Singh, but it could not do any harm to him;

gurmukhi: Pyir hTI hiT kY hir isau iem bYn mhwN kir kop sunwXo ] kw khIXy iqh pMifq ko ijh qy Dn kI ibiD qUM piV AwXo ]1188]
transliteration: Pher(i) Hathee(i) Kai Har(i) Sio Im Bain Mahaan Kar(i) Kop Sounaayo|| Kaa Kaheeye Tih Pandit Ko Jih Te Dhan Kibidh(i) Toon Pad(i) Aayo||1188||
translation: That mighty warrior said angrily to Krishna, “O Krishna, who is such a Pundit, from whom you have learnt the art of warfare.1188.

gurmukhi: kop BrI jduvI pRqnw ieq qy aumfI auq qy vh AweI ] mwr hI mwr kIey muK qy kib sXwm khY ijX ros bFweI ]
transliteration: Kop Bharijadvvipratnaa It Te Oumdiout Te Vah Aaee|| Maar Himaar Keee Moukh Te Kabi Syaam Kahai Jiya Rao Badhaaee||
translation: The Yadava army, in great fury, rushed there shouting “Kill, Kill”;

gurmukhi: bwn kiRpwn gdw ky lgy bhu jUiJ pry kir duMd lrweI ] rIJ rhy sur pyK sBY puhpwvl kI brKw brKweI ]1189]
transliteration: Baan Kridaan Gadaa Ke Lage Bahu Jhoojh(i) Dare Kar(i0 Doond Laraaireejh Rahe Sur Pekh Sabhai Puhpaaval Kibarkhaa Barkhaaee||
translation: In that war, a great part of the army fell down on the earth with the blows of arrows, swords and maces in that conflict; the gods on seeing this became pleased and showered flowers.1189.

gurmukhi: ieq qy rn mY irs bIr lrY niB mY bHmwid inhwrY ] Awgy nw AYso BXo kbhUM rn Awpis mY iem boil aucwrY ]
transliteration: It Te Ran Mai Ris Beer Darai Nabh(i) Mai Bradhmaadh Sanaadh Nihdarai|| Ooge Naa Aiso Bhayo Kab-hoon Ran Aapas(i) Mai Im Bol(i) Ouchdarai||
translation: On this side, the warriors are fighting in great rage and on the other side, seeing all this, Brahma and other gods are saying amongst themselves in the sky: “There had not been such a dreadful war earlier;”

gurmukhi: jUiJ pry iqh sRaun Fry Br K`pr ju`gn pI iklkwrY ] muMfn mwl Anyk guhI iSv ky gx DMnu hI DMin pukwrY ]1190]
transliteration: Joojh(i) Dare Tih Sraoun Ddare Bhar Khappar Judgad Pikilkdarai|| Mounndan Maal Anek Guhishiv Ke Gad Dhann(u) Hidhann(i) Poukdarai||1190||
translation: The warriors are fighting to the end and the Yoginis are shrieking while filling their bowls with blood and drinking; the ganas of Shiva, hailing the warriors, are preparing many garlands of skulls.1190.

gurmukhi: AwXuD Dwr AXoDn mY iek kop Bry Bt Dwie ArY ] iek m`l kI dwien ju`D krY iek dyK mhwN rx daur prY ]
transliteration: Ooyudh Dhaar Ayodhan Mai Ik Kop Bhare Bhat Dhaaedarai|| Ik Mall Kidaain Juddh Darai Ik Dekh Mahaan Ran Daur Darai||
translation: Carrying his weapons, some warrior, running forward in the battlefield is seen resisting; someone is fighting like a wrestler and someone seeing the dreadful war, is running away;
